root_cause: MODNet had NO special handling in Docker harness (unlike deepchem/oggm/scanpy). Also, pickle files contain MODNet-specific objects that cannot be deserialized without modnet installed.
fix_description: 1) Added MODNet handler to dockerfiles.py to install pymatgen and matminer when modnet is detected. 2) instruction_override tells agent to include proper modnet imports.
harness_modification: Added to dockerfiles.py: if grep -q 'modnet' then add pymatgen and matminer to requirements
notes: This was the most critical IFE because even loading the input data was impossible without MODNet installed. The pickle files contain MODData class instances.
